cultural_notes_overrides.formality: In Puerto Rico, phone numbers are often read as three groups — area code (787 or 939), then two groups of four digits. Age is asked and shared freely in casual conversation.
cultural_notes_overrides.gestures: Puerto Ricans may use 'bregar' (to deal with, to handle) when talking about numbers in context — 'Tengo que bregar con eso' (I have to deal with that). Numbers in addresses sometimes use English street names.
cultural_notes_overrides.regional_variations: Many Puerto Ricans switch to English numbers when giving phone numbers or addresses, especially with younger speakers. Both are perfectly acceptable — '55 / fifty-five' are interchangeable.
